intro: Gaultheria soror var. soror, commonly known as the narrowleaf wintergreen, is a species native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a low-growing evergreen shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features lanceolate, dark green leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its small, bell-shaped white flowers appear in late spring, followed by dark red berries in the fall. The leaves and berries contain aromatic oils, which have been historically used in traditional medicine.
